Hi,

It is possible to construct a reactor network where single reactors ar=
e 
held at the same pressure (seperated by pressure sensitive walls) while =

a moving wall implements a total vdot for all reactors in the network.

Is=
 it possible to also implement a pressure regulator on a reactor that 
has =
a fixed volume, so that the pressure is controlled instead by mass 
flow in=
/out of the reactor. The pressure regulator device states which 
direction =
the flow will be. So having two pressure regulators, each 
with flow in the=
 opposite direction, between two reactors would achieve 
pressure equilibri=
um by means of mass transfer. It this approach 
possible, when these two re=
actors are in the reactor network outlined 
above (with vdot applied).

The=
 question arises because, at some time t, the pressure in reactor 1 
would =
be higher than reactor 2, therefore mass flow would be to reactor 
2, but l=
ater, at time t2, when reactor 2 has a higher pressure than 
reactor 1, the=
 mass could not flow back into reactor 1, therefore 
pressure equilibrium w=
ould not be achieved, if only one pressure 
regulator were applied.

Hoping=
 someone has some experience of such area's.

Many thanks in advance of cou=
rse,

Adam.
